messages.message: I’m setting up my new M1 Mac and although Poetry installed successfully I”m getting a `poetry: command not found`.
I’ve also found that ZSH on mac doesn’t like to pick up new on-$PATH executables for some weird reason, so I usually do a quick `exec zsh` after an install to force it

hmm no:
```poetry env use $(pyenv root)/versions/$(grep '^python =' pyproject.toml | cut -d '"' -f 2)/bin/python && poetry install
/bin/sh: poetry: command not found```
thats from one of the services trying to start

oooh I see
Might be that `poetry env use` is a self-sabotage move :smile:
ie: it might be clearing and setting it’s own `$PATH` env var, and thus ‘losing itself’

Quite the existential issue, but also speculative on my part. :joy:
ok, so I installed poetry via homebrew
and I have things up and running now

Sweet!
Thanks for humoring my flailing attempts :smile: I don’t know much about the tool itself
